column1: #Text=Polycrystalline Cu2Se bulk materials were synthesized at\rdifferent temperatures (25 \C, 240 \C, 540 \C, 840 \C and 1000 \C)\rand high pressures (3 GPa, 4 GPa and 5 GPa) by HPHT technology.

#Text=Appropriate amounts of Cu (99.9%, 45 mm) and Se (99.99%, 75 mm)\rwere weighed according to the stoichiometry of Cu2Se, grinded\runder Ar atmosphere, and then cold pressed into disks with the size\rof Ф10.5 \ 4 mm.
#Text=The as-pressed disks were subjected to a model\r6 \ 1200 large volume cubic high-pressure apparatus (Guilin Guiye\rMachinery Co., China) at different temperatures and pressures for\r30 min.
#Text=The HPHT conditions in the sample chamber were implemented\rby graphite crucible and hydraulic pressed multianvil\rtechnique.
#Text=The temperature was measured by Pt-30%Rh/Pt-6%Rh\rthermocouple on the surface of the samples.
#Text=The pressure was\rcalibrated by the resistance change of standard materials.
#Text=At the\rend of the synthesis process, the pressurewas manually released to\ratmospheric pressure after the sample chamber was quenched to\rroom temperature.
#Text=The obtained disks were crushed and ground\rinto fine powders, which were then sintered for 5 min under the\rcorresponding synthetic pressure to obtain the final samples.
